page.title: 16A Norfolk Reed Thatcher
page.content: {Mr Cossey}has been a reed thatcher for nearly 40yrs.He learned his trade working with another thatcher but never served an apprenticeship.He has seen the number of thatchers in his part of Salhouse dwindle from 30+ before the war to himself. The reeds come from within a radius of 20 miles including{Ludham,Horning} and{Catfield.}They are bought ready prepared in bundles and stored under a thatched roof in Mr Cossey's garden. Although he has not been abroad to work, Mr Cossey has thatched roofs as far away as Cornwall.About 20yrs ago he did some work for Maxwell Joseph,a multi-millionaire hotelier. The strangest building Mr Cossey has thatched is a 200-300ft water tower on the Barnet by-pass!When finishing a roof,Mr Cossey chooses a pattern to suit its character.
